instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2533: What is 820-2533? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V5_S0: What is PP1V5_S0? PP1V5_S0 is a 1.5v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Hd not detected?
threads.message:
Hi,
Unit works with usb external HD. Tried good know hd cable and HD. Not booting unlimited spinning with good known HD.
The measurement of J4501 are as following:
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_MGMT_SCL</SIGNAL> p7=3v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0_HDD_FLT</SIGNAL> p9,11=5v
<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S0_HDD_FLT</SIGNAL>, p8=5v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0_HDD_FLT</SIGNAL>,p10,12=5v
 Any help please.Thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Hd not detected?
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S0_HDD_FLT</SIGNAL>, p8=5v"
Are you sure???
It comes from <SIGNAL>PP1V5_S0</SIGNAL>; is L4502 OK?

Check FL4501/02 and <CAPACITOR>C4510</CAPACITOR>/11/15/16.
Also check all traces from that area.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Hd not detected?
threads.message: I found the cable was faulty. It works fine now. Thank.
